bugtrap03.bugdomain

Class Subsystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • bugtrap03.bugdomain.notificationdomain.Subject
      • bugtrap03.bugdomain.notificationdomain.AbstractSystemSubject
        • bugtrap03.bugdomain.AbstractSystem
          • bugtrap03.bugdomain.Subsystem

  • public class Subsystem
extends AbstractSystem
    This class is a subclass of abstract system (versionID, name, description and Childs list). This type also contains a bug report PList, containing the bug reports linked to this subsystem.
    Author:
    Group 03

      • Subsystem

        protected Subsystem(VersionID version,
                    java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.String description,
                    AbstractSystem parent)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This constructor makes an element of the class subsystem, using it's superclass, AbstractSystem, constructor.
        Parameters:
        version - The versionID (of that type) of this element.
        name - The string name for this element.
        description - The string description of this element.
        parent - The parent (a Project or Subsystem) of this element.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the String arguments is invalid.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the version id is invalid.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parent is invalid for this subsystem
        See Also:
        AbstractSystem.AbstractSystem(AbstractSystem, VersionID, String, String)

      • addBugReport

        @Ensures(value="result.getTag() == Tag.New && result.getUniqueID() != null")
public BugReport addBugReport(User creator,
                                                                                                            java.lang.String title,
                                                                                                            java.lang.String description,
                                                                                                            java.util.GregorianCalendar creationDate,
                                                                                                            purecollections.PList<BugReport> dependencies,
                                                                                                            Milestone milestone,
                                                                                                            double impactFactor,
                                                                                                            boolean isPrivate,
                                                                                                            java.lang.String trigger,
                                                                                                            java.lang.String stacktrace,
                                                                                                            java.lang.String error)
                                                                                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                                                            PermissionException
        This method creates and adds a bug report to the list of associated bugReports of this subsystem
        Parameters:
        creator - The User that wants to create this bug report
        title - The title of the bugReport
        description - The description of the bugReport
        creationDate - The creationDate of the bugReport
        dependencies - The depended bug reports of this bug report
        milestone - The milestone of the bug report
        impactFactor - The impact factor of the new bug rport
        isPrivate - The boolean that says if this bug report should be private or not
        trigger - A trigger used to trigger the bug
        stacktrace - The stacktrace got when the bug was triggered
        error - The error got when the bug was triggered
        Returns:
        The create bug report


        Postconditions:
        if creationDate == null: result.getDate() == current date at the moment of initialization
        Postconditions:
        result.getUniqueID() is an unique ID for this bug report
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if isValidCreator(creator) fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if isValidUniqueID(uniqueID) fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if isValidTitle(title) fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if isValidDescription(description) fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if isValidCreationDate(creationDate) fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if isValidDependencies(dependencies) fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if isValidSubSystem(subsystem) fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if isValidMilestone(milestone) fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given impact factor is invalid
        PermissionException - if the given creator doesn't have the needed permission to create a bug report
        See Also:
        BugReport.isValidCreator(User), BugReport.isValidUniqueID(long), BugReport.isValidTitle(String), BugReport.isValidDescription(String), BugReport.isValidCreationDate(GregorianCalendar), BugReport.isValidDependencies(PList), BugReport.isValidSubsystem(Subsystem), BugReport.isValidMilestone(Milestone), BugReport.isValidImpactFactor(double)

      • deleteBugReport

        public void deleteBugReport(BugReport bugReport)
        Remove the given bugReport from the list of bugReports.
        Only use with Caution: No other changes will be made. (e.g no dependencies or milestones will be changed.)
        Parameters:
        bugReport - The bugReport to delete.

      • cloneSubsystem

        public Subsystem cloneSubsystem(AbstractSystem parent)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns a copy of the current subsystem, using the same versionID, name, description and parent, but with a removal of the bug reports addressed to this subsystem.
        Returns:
        the clone of the subsystem
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the VersionID is invalid
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the string arguments is invalid
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parent is invalid
        See Also:
        Subsystem(VersionID, String, String, AbstractSystem)

      • split

        public Subsystem split(java.lang.String name1,
                       java.lang.String desc1,
                       java.lang.String name2,
                       java.lang.String desc2,
                       purecollections.PList<Subsystem> subsystems1,
                       purecollections.PList<BugReport> bugReports1,
                       User user)
                throws PermissionException,
                       java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       java.lang.IllegalStateException
        This will split this Subsystem into this and another Subsystem.
        This Subsystem will keep all its direct Subsystems and BugReports that are also in subsystems1 and bugReports1 respectively. The rest of the direct Subsystems and BugReports will go to the extra Subsystem.

        Warning: A invalid argument may cause a partially executed split. e.g Invalid argument for the 2nd subsystem may still cause the name and description for subsystem 1 to be set before the error.

        Parameters:
        name1 - The name for this Subsystem.
        desc1 - The description for this Subsystem.
        name2 - The name for the extra Subsystem.
        desc2 - The description for the extra Subsystem.
        subsystems1 - The subsystems that will be part of this Subsystem if they are now also direct Subsystems.
        bugReports1 - The bugReports that will be part if this Subsystem if they are now also direct BugReports.
        user - The user who wants to split the subsystem.
        Returns:
        The extra created Subsystem.
        Throws:
        PermissionException - When user does not have sufficient permissions.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this is terminated.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When subsystems1 == null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When bugReports1 == null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When any of the arguments is invalid. (such as name and description).

      • mergeWithSubsystem

        public Subsystem mergeWithSubsystem(User user,
                                    Subsystem subsystem,
                                    java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.String description)
                             throws PermissionException,
                                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        WARNING: This method doesn't guarantee a consistent state of the subsystem if it fails!

        This method merges a given subsystem with this subsystem and renames this subsystem and redefines the description

        Parameters:
        user - The user that wants to merge the subsystems
        subsystem - The subsystem to merge with
        name - The new name of this subsystem
        description - The new description of this subsystem
        Returns:
        The merged subsystem
        Throws:
        PermissionException - If the given user doesn't have the needed permission to merge subsystems
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If one of the given arguments is invalid
        See Also:
        AbstractSystem.isValidName(String), AbstractSystem.isValidDescription(String), isValidMergeSubsystem(Subsystem)

      • getCompatibleMergeSubs

        public purecollections.PList<Subsystem> getCompatibleMergeSubs()
        This method returns a list of compatible subsystems to merge with this subsystem
        Returns:
        a PList of compatible subsystems to merge with this subsystem

      • isValidMergeSubsystem

        public boolean isValidMergeSubsystem(Subsystem subsystem)
        This method checks whether or not the given subsystem can be merged with this subsystem
        Parameters:
        subsystem - The child or sibling subsystem to merge
        Returns:
        The given subsystem must be a sibling OR the parent of the given subsystem must be this. Both this and the subsystem must not be terminated.
